program called "testdisk" saved me a lot of data I thought lost
it's available from ubuntu repositories - just use synaptic packet manager (or add/remove programs) to get it
you can also download it from http://www.cgsecurity.org/wiki/TestDisk
but it's not the most easiest to use, unfortunately
probably worth to check out the live-cd's too: http://www.cgsecurity.org/wiki/TestDisk_Livecd
testdisk isn't the most impossible program I've had to use either. with reading some instuctions, you can get far
linux isn't really any more hard than windows, but the type of help you get for windows is often a lot less technical. (the problem is getting it, though...)

a lot of your data seems disapperaed. undertsandable. if you have a friend that's more computer-savvy, you might suggest to her/him to try using TestDisk on your computer - maybe she/he can recover the data.
there isn't really much more I can help though IRC. :-/
guiding through TestDisk (where to run it, what to do with it, what to recover, etc) is really something one would have to be at your computer to do...
also, I don't recommend using the same computer that contained the data you want to recover.
or rather, the same hard disk.
well, irc really doesn't matter
just don't go downloading huge files and such.

since the system doesn't know about the lost data anymore, it won't know how to avoid messing it up. The idea is that the data is still there, but the system doesn't know where, so it might accidentally step on it during writes to hard disk
